title: Rosebud Plaza sells for $135 million
excerpt: Who said retail was dead? It's certainly not in Rosebud, where Charter Hall has just sold Rosebud Plaza for $134.5 million.
imageAlt: Who said retail was dead? It's certainly not in Rosebud, where Charter Hall has just sold Rosebud Plaza for $134.5 million.
author: Building Environs

sections.alt: Who said retail was dead? It's certainly not in Rosebud, where Charter Hall has just sold Rosebud Plaza for $134.5 million.
sections.caption: Image credit: Rosebud Plaza

sections.content: Who said retail was dead? It's certainly not in Rosebud, where Charter Hall has just sold Rosebud Plaza for $134.5 million.
It follows a significant renovation of the facility, designed to develop a 'sense of belonging,' as well as enhance the retail offering to the local community.

Located on Victoria's Mornington Peninsula, the shopping centre is home to a Woolworths, Coles, Dan Murphy's, BCF showroom and Kmart, along with a string of smaller retail tenants. The buyer is an unnamed, private investor based in Sydney.
Charter Hall originally purchased the site in 2013 for $100 million from CFS Retail Property Trust.

This sale comes off the back of another significant divestment by Charter Hall â€“ the sale of an [industrial facility in Truganina](https://www.buildingenvirons.com.au/significant-sale-kickstarts-1-billion-portfolio/) at the end of 2023, for a whopping $94.1 million.
